description:
'''Dream pop''' is a subgenre of [[alternative rock]] and [[neo-psychedelia]] that emphasizes atmosphere and sonic texture as strongly as it does [[pop music|pop]] melody. Common characteristics include breathy vocals, dense productions, and effects such as [[reverb]], [[echo]], [[tremolo (electronic effect)|tremolo]], and [[chorus (audio effect)|chorus]]. It often overlaps with the related genre of [[shoegaze]], and the two genre terms have at times been used interchangeably.

Dream pop came into prominence in the 1980s through groups associated with the UK label [[4AD]], most prominently [[Cocteau Twins]] and [[This Mortal Coil]], and later [[A.R. Kane]], who are credited with coining the term. During the late 1980s to early 1990s, the genre saw further proliferation through UK-based artists such as [[My Bloody Valentine (band)|My Bloody Valentine]], [[Slowdive]], and [[Lush (band)|Lush]] alongside US-based acts [[Galaxie 500]], [[Julee Cruise]], and [[Mazzy Star]]. By the late 2000s, the sound saw renewed popularity among [[millennial]] listeners through bands such as [[Beach House (band)|Beach House]].
